intro: Gnaphalium cochinchinense, commonly known as the Vietnamese feather grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fluffy flower heads that resemble miniature dandelions. The plant produces yellowish to brownish composite flowers, which are composed of numerous tiny florets. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries like Vietnam and Cambodia, and thrives in moist, open habitats. Gnaphalium cochinchinense is often found in grasslands, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
